page.title: Humanitarian response to the 2010 Chile earthquake

revisions.rev:
{{See also|2010 Chile earthquake|date=March 2010}} {{TOC right}}
The '''Humanitarian response to the [[2010 Chile earthquake]]''' included national governments, charitable and for-profit organizations from around the world which began coordinating humanitarian aid designed to help the Chilean people.
==National governments==
* {{flag|Argentina}}: [[President of Argentina|President]] [[Cristina FernÃ¡ndez de Kirchner]] called [[President of Chile|President]] [[Michelle Bachelet]] and offered "all the needed aid." Meanwhile, Argentine [[Argentina-Chile relations|Ambassador to Chile]], [[GinÃ©s GonzÃ¡lez GarcÃ­a]], said that his country "will do everything possible" to aid Chile.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.losandes.com.ar/notas/2010/2/27/un-474860.asp|title=Cristina llamÃ³ a Bachelet y le ofreciÃ³ ayuda|date=February 27, 2010|publisher=Diario Los Andes|accessdate=27 February 2010}}</ref> Medical supplies sent by Argentina had arrived in Chileâthe first batch of international relief aid the country has received after Saturday's devastating earthquake, Chile's Defense Ministry said Sunday.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/world/2010-03/01/content_9520236.htm|title=International aid starts to arrive in quake-hit Chile |date=2010-03-01|accessdate=2010-03-01|publisher=China Daily}}</ref> On March 1, Chile requested Argentina the sending of three [[field hospital]]s, including a [[Argentine Air Force Mobile Field Hospital|similar one deployed in Haiti]].<ref>[http://www.clarin.com/diario/2010/03/01/elmundo/i-02149875.htm Chile pide ayuda a la Argentina: envÃ­an 3 hospitales de campaÃ±a]</ref> President Cristina Kirchner also announced the delivery of 1800 tons of food and more than a half millions liters of water.<ref>[http://www.clarin.com/diario/2010/03/01/um/m-02150374.htm ''mÃ¡s de 1.800 toneladas de alimentos bÃ¡sicos no perecederos junto a mÃ¡s de medio millÃ³n de litros de agua mineral'']</ref> Four water purifications plants and four electricity power generators were also included.<ref>[http://www.clarin.com/diario/2010/03/01/um/m-02150374.htm Argentina enviarÃ¡ ayudas en salud, energÃ­a y agua a Chile]</ref> The first [[C-130 Hercules]], of eight scheduled flights,<ref>[http://www.mindef.gov.ar/info.asp?Id=1368 mindef:CONTINÃA LA INSTALACIÃN DE UN HOSPITAL DE CAMPAÃA EN CHILE]</ref> was dispatched on March 1<ref>[http://www.gacetamarinera.com.ar/nota.asp?idNota=1634&idSec=7 La Armada Argentina enviÃ³ equipamiento para asistir a Chile]</ref> and the 12 modules [[Argentine Air Force]] hospital would be located at [[CuricÃ³]].<ref>[http://www.mindef.gov.ar/info.asp?Id=1365 mindef:PARTIÃ HACIA CHILE AVIÃN HÃRCULES CON AYUDA HUMANITARIA]</ref> On March 5 an Air Force [[Fokker F-28]] was sent to Concepcion to evacuate residents <ref>[http://www.minutouno.com.ar/minutouno/nota/125710-Lleg%C3%B3-al-pa%C3%ADs-avi%C3%B3n-con-argentinos-que-sufrieron-el-sismo-en-Concepci%C3%B3n/ LlegÃ³ al paÃ­s aviÃ³n con argentinos que sufrieron el sismo en ConcepciÃ³n ''55 personas, en su mayorÃ­a habitantes del paÃ­s vecino afectados por el terremoto'']</ref> On March 6 Argentine Health minister announces the sending of ten thousand doses of vaccine against [[hepatitis A]] <ref>[http://www.clarin.com/diario/2010/03/06/um/m-02153770.htm Argentina enviarÃ¡ diez mil dosis de vacunas contra la hepatitis A ]</ref> On March 8, the [[Ministry of Defense (Argentina)|Argentine Ministry of Defense]] announced that, after 9 flights, the [[Argentine Air Force Mobile Field Hospital|field hospital]] at Curico is already operational.<ref>[http://www.mindef.gov.ar/info.asp?Id=1376 EL HOSPITAL DE CAMPAÃA ARGENTINO INSTALADO EN CHILE YA ESTÃ EN FUNCIONAMIENTO]</ref> On March 13 the benefit concert ''Argentina Abraza Chile'' is done at [[Buenos Aires]] <ref>[http://www.lanacion.com.ar/nota.asp?nota_id=1243066 Cerati, Calamaro y Gieco en un recital a beneficio de Chile]</ref>
* {{flag|Australia}}: Prime Minister [[Kevin Rudd]] offered any possible assistance to the Chilean government.<ref name="china1">{{Cite web|url=http://www.china.org.cn/world/chilequake/2010-02/28/content_19490551.htm |title=Int'l community offers condolences, aid to quake-hit Chile |date=February 28, 2010}}</ref>
* {{flag|Bolivia}}: Bolivian President Evo Morales made a visit to Chile and was the only president to carry food an aid on his plane, then he announced half of his monthly salary will be donated to the earthquake tragedy of Chile and Haiti, Bolivia sent aid to Chile and the Bolivian people collected $1.3 million for Chile and Haiti.
* {{flag|Brazil}}: Brazilian president [[Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva]] said that he had "deep concern for the impact of the earthquake" and ordered the cabinet to evaluate Chile's situation and the assistance Brazil could give.<ref name="china1"/> An aircraft from the [[Brazilian Air Force]] was used to transport Chile's justice minister and attorney general back to Chile.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.fab.mil.br/portal/capa/index.php?mostra=4808 |title=Nota Ã imprensa : aeronave da FAB decola para o Chile |date=2010-02-27}}</ref> After attending the induction of the [[Uruguay]]an President [[JosÃ© Mujica]], President Lula made a short visit to Santiago to meet President Bachelet.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://online.wsj.com/article/BT-CO-20100301-712695.html?mod=WSJ_World_MIDDLEHeadlinesAmericas |title=Brazil's Lula Due To Arrive Shortly In Santiago - WSJ.com |publisher=Online.wsj.com |date=2010-03-01 |accessdate=2010-03-08}} {{Dead link|date=August 2010|bot=RjwilmsiBot}}</ref> On March 2, 2010, Brasil sent two [[UH-60 Blackhawk]] of the [[Brazilian Air Force]] to Chile.<ref>{{Cite web|author=Agencia Brasil |url=http://www.agenciabrasil.gov.br/?q=node/1185 |title=Brasil envia dois helicÃ³pteros para o Chile e prepara aeronaves para transportar hospital de campanha |publisher=Agencia Brasil |date= |accessdate=2010-03-08}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.correiobraziliense.com.br/app/noticia182/2010/03/02/mundo,i=177000/BRASIL+ENVIA+DOIS+HELICOPTEROS+PARA+O+CHILE.shtml |title=Mundo - Brasil envia dois helicÃ³pteros para o Chile |publisher=Correio Braziliense |date= |accessdate=2010-03-08}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|author=DPD-WEB - Cecomsaer - Sgt Poleto |url=http://www.fab.mil.br/portal/capa/index.php?mostra=4827 |title=ForÃ§a AÃ©rea Brasileira :: |publisher=FAB |date= |accessdate=2010-03-08}}</ref> The Brazilian Air Force has also sent aircraft transporting the Brazilian Navy field hospital and its 47 personnel on March 3.<ref>{{Cite web|author=DPD-WEB - Cecomsaer - Sgt Poleto |url=http://www.fab.mil.br/portal/capa/index.php?mostra=4830 |title=ForÃ§a AÃ©rea Brasileira :: |publisher=FAB |date= |accessdate=2010-03-08}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mar.mil.br/menu_h/noticias/ccsm/campanha_ao_chile/hospital_campanha.html |title=Marinha envia Hospital de Campanha ao Chile |publisher=Mar.mil.br |date= |accessdate=2010-03-08}}</ref>
* {{Flag|Canada}}: The [[Canadian government]] is currently monitoring the situation and is aware of the approximately 1,100 Canadians in Chile. Non-government organizations have already responded, including [[Global Medic]], from [[Toronto]], will reassign volunteers already in [[Haiti]], the [[Canadian Red Cross]] is also monitoring the situation and [[list of diplomatic missions of Canada|Canadian embassies]] along the western seaboard, as well as [[Vancouver]], where the [[2010 Winter Olympics|2010 Olympics]] were being held, have been put on alert.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ctv.ca/servlet/ArticleNews/story/CTVNews/20100227/canada_quake_100227/20100227?hub=TopStoriesV2|title=Canada offers assistance to Chile following quake|accessdate=2010-02-27|publisher=[[CTV.ca]]}}</ref> The [[Chilean government]] has specifically asked Canada for a [[field hospital]], a [[pontoon bridge]], [[generators]] and [[telecommunications]] equipment.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/world/story/2010/03/01/canada-chile-ortega.html|title=Chile asks Canada for help|publisher=[[CBC.ca]]|date=2010-03-01|accessdate=2010-03-02}}</ref> Bev Oda minsister of international cooperation announced on March 3, 2010 that Canada would give $2 million in aid to Chile.<ref>www.msn.ca</ref>
* {{Flag icon|Taiwan}} [[Taiwan|Republic of China (on Taiwan)]]: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs expressed condolences and offered assistance to ONEMI, the Chilean emergency and disaster agency.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mofa.gov.tw/webapp/content.asp?cuItem=43648&mp=1 |title=ä¸­è¯æ°åå¤äº¤é¨ - æ°èç¨¿ |publisher=Mofa.gov.tw |date=2010-02-28 |accessdate=2010-03-08}}</ref>
[[File:ChileEarthquakeDamage.jpg|right|thumb|Structural damage caused by the earthquake.]]
* {{Flag|China}}: President [[Hu Jintao]] released a message of condolence to President Bachelet and offered emergency relief assistance to affected areas. He said, "On behalf of the Chinese government as well as in his own name, extended sincere condolences to Bachelet, the Chilean people and government as well as deep sympathies to the earthquake victims."<ref name="xinhuanet1">{{Cite news|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english2010/world/2010-02/28/c_13191071.htm|title=Int'l community offers sympathy, aid to quake-stricken Chile|date=February 28, 2010|publisher=Xinhua News Agency|accessdate=27 February 2010}}</ref> On March 6, the Chinese government sent a plane to [[Santiago, Chile|Santiago]] containing roughly $2,000,000 U.S. Dollars worth of aid.<ref>http://english.peopledaily.com.cn/90001/90776/90883/6910676.html</ref>
* {{Flag|Colombia}}: The Colombian Government expressed condolences and is ready to help this neighbour country by sending any help that the Government of Chile requests and also helping it through its embassy in Santiago.<ref>[http://www.cancilleria.gov.co/wps/portal/espanol/!ut/p/c1/04_SB8K8xLLM9MSSzPy8xBz9CP0os_jQsKAwo2AXYwN_3yBTA6MwH7NAL1djI_dQE30_j_zcVP2CbEdFAIiEiFo!/dl2/d1/L2dJQSEvUUt3QS9ZQnB3LzZfODVGOVVPMTMwR0QxRDAyRjcwM0Y5TTEwMTA!/?WCM_GLOBAL_CONTEXT=/wps/wcm/connect/WCM_PRENSA/prensa/comunicados/comunicado+27feb10 Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores]</ref>
* {{Flag|Costa Rica}}: The Costa Rican government communicated through an official note its solidarity to the victims of the earthquake.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Arias intenta comunicarse con presidenta de Chile para expresar solidaridad|url=http://www.nacion.com/2010-02-27/ElPais/UltimaHora/ElPais2284409.aspx}}</ref> The National Emergencies Commission volunteered to send 3 structural engineers to help evaluate the conditions of the still-standing structures.<ref>[http://es.noticias.yahoo.com/9/20100303/tsc-costa-rica-enviara-a-chile-ingeniero-23e7ce8.html Costa Rica enviarÃ¡ a Chile ingenieros para evaluar hospitales y escuelas]</ref>
* {{Flag|Cuba}}: The Cuban government has sent a total of 36 doctors who have set up a temporary hospital in [[Rancagua]], in the [[Cachapoal Province]].<ref>http://english.people.com.cn/90001/90777/90852/6911842.html</ref> Cuba has also donated about 12 tons of medicine and medical equipment to Chile.<ref>http://www.juventudrebelde.cu/internacionales/2010-03-03/destacan-pronto-envio-de-ayuda-medica-cubana-a-chile/</ref> Several organs of the Cuban government as well as Ex-president [[Fidel Castro]] have also sent their condolences and have expressed solidarity with Chile.<ref>http://www.realbollywood.com/news/2010/03/cuban-filmmakers-express-support-quakehit-chile.html</ref><ref>http://www.emol.com/noticias/internacional/detalle/detallenoticias.asp?idnoticia=402418</ref>
* {{Flag|Dominican Republic}}: The president of the [[Dominican Republic]] [[Leonel FernÃ¡ndez]] spoke about the Chilean earthquake a few hours after the earthquake occurred, while presenting a previously scheduled speech about his tenure during the year 2009. He stated, "Our hearts and our prayers are with you" and expressed his solidarity with the Chilean people.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Presidente FernÃ¡ndez se solidariza con tragedia chilena|url=http://www.diariolibre.com/noticias_det.php?id=236056}}</ref>
* {{Flag|Ecuador}}: The president of Ecuador, Rafael Correa, issued a statement of condolence saying, "You can count on us for any help we can give. A big hug for the Chilean people and beloved President Bachelet."<ref name="china1"/>
* {{Flag|France}}: French President [[Nicolas Sarkozy]] expressed his "deep emotion", while Foreign Minister Bernard Kouchner said Paris "in consultation with its European Union partners is ready to respond to the Chilean demands for assistance."<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.expatica.com/ch/news/swiss-rss-news/world-pledges-aid-to-quake-hit-chile_26880.html|title=World pledges aid to quake-hit Chile|publisher=expatica.com|date=2010-02-27|accessdate=2010-03-01}}</ref>
* {{Flag|Germany}}: German Foreign Minister [[Guido Westerwelle]] issued a statement saying that Germany was sending an expert team from the [[Technisches Hilfswerk|German Federal Agency for Technical Relief]] to Chile to find out how it could offer technical assistance.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://english.people.com.cn/90001/90777/90853/6904350.html |title=Germany sends disaster assistance team to Chile |accessdate=28/02/10}}</ref>
* {{Flag|Haiti}}: Haiti, already devastated by the [[2010 Haiti earthquake]], sent condolences to the Chilean government. Haitian President [[RenÃ© PrÃ©val]] went to the Chilean embassy and expressed condolence.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Luhnow|first=David|url=http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052748704231304575092002332354656.html?mod=WSJ_hpp_MIDDLTopStories|title=Chile Quake Resonates in Haiti â WSJ.com|publisher=Online.wsj.com|date=February 27, 2010|accessdate=2010-02-28}}</ref>
* {{Flag|Iceland}}: The [[president of Iceland]] sent president [[Michelle Bachelet]] condolences on behalf of the Icelandic people. The president hoped that the unity of Chileans and the international community would help relieve from the devastation that followed the earthquake.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://visir.is/article/20100301/FRETTIR01/207185269 |title=VÃ­sir - Forsetinn sendir samÃºÃ°arkveÃ°ju til Chile |publisher=Visir.is |date= |accessdate=2010-03-08}}</ref>
* {{Flag|India}}: NBD reports " Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh today condoled the loss of lives in the earthquake in Chile and pledged USD five million support for relief and rehabilitation work there." "On behalf of the Government and people of India, I would like to express deep sympathy and condolences to the people of Chile on the great tragedy. Our thoughts and prayers are with the bereaved families", the Prime Minister said in a letter to Chilean President Michelle Bachelet.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.brunei.fm/2010/03/05/india-pledges-us5-million-support-for-quake-hit-chile/ |title=INDIA PLEDGES US$5 MILLION SUPPORT FOR QUAKE-HIT CHILE | Brunei NEWS, Brunei HEADLINES from Brunei fm |publisher=News.brunei.fm |date= |accessdate=2010-03-08}}</ref>
* {{Flag|Israel}}: The Israeli government issued a statement saying that "Israel stands by the side of the government and the people of Chile, and expresses its solidarity with them in the face of the devastating earthquake that has befallen their country. Israel wishes to send its condolences to the bereaved families and to express its support to all the citizens of Chile in this time of trial."<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/1152621.html More than 300 killed in Chile quake; tsunami reaches Hawaii] Retrieved on 28/02/10</ref> The government has offered medical and engineering aid and is awaiting a response from the Chilean government.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3856453,00.html |title=Israel offers aid to quake-struck Chile - Israel News, Ynetnews |publisher=Ynetnews.com |date=1995-06-20 |accessdate=2010-03-08}}</ref>
*{{flag|Japan}} Prime Minister [[Yukio Hatoyama]] ordered preparation for relief and support activities.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.jiji.com/jc/c?g=pol&rel=j7&k=2010022700292|title=é³©å±±é¦ç¸ãæ¯æ´æºåãæç¤ºï¼ããªå¤§å°éã§|date=February 27, 2010|publisher=JIJI|language=Japanese|accessdate=28 February 2010}}</ref>
* {{Flag|Jordan}}: [[Abdullah II of Jordan|Abdullah II bin al-Hussein]], the current king of the Kingdom of Jordan, expressed his deepest sympathies over the loss of life caused by the earthquake via a telegram sent to Chilean President Michelle Bachelet.<ref>[http://www.jordantimes.com/?news=24406 Massive earthquake strikes Chile] Retrieved on 28/02/10</ref>
* {{Flag|Kosovo}}: President [[Fatmir Sejdiu]] sent a message of condolence to President Bachelet and President-elect PiÃ±era offering "...the deepest sympathies of the people and the institutions of the Republic of Kosovo."<ref>[http://www.president-ksgov.net/site/?id=5,67,67,67,e,323 President Sejdiu conveyed his condolences to Chilean authorities] Retrieved on 03/03/10</ref>
* {{Flag|Kuwait}}: His Highness the Amir Sheikh Sabah Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah sent a cable President Michelle Bachelet Jeria expressing sincere condolences, wished the injured a swift recovery and that Chilean officials would be able to overcome the impact of this natural disaster. His Highness the Deputy Amir and Crown Prince Sheikh Nawaf Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah also sent a cable of condolences to the Chilean president. His Highness the Prime Minister Sheikh Nawaf Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah did the same.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.brunei.fm/2010/02/28/kuwaiti-leadership-extends-condolences-to-chile-on-quake-victims/ |title=Kuwaiti Leadership Extends Condolences To Chile On Quake Victims | Brunei News, Brunei Headlines From Brunei Fm |publisher=News.brunei.fm |date=2010-02-28 |accessdate=2010-03-08}}</ref>
* {{Flag|Malaysia}}: Malaysia's foreign ministry conveyed Malaysia's condolences and deep sympathy to the victims of the massive earthquake that hit Chile.<ref>[http://www.bernama.com/bernama/v5/newsgeneral.php?id=478532 Malaysia Conveys Condolences To Chile Earthquake Victims] Retrieved on 28/02/10</ref>
* {{Flag|Mexico}}: The government of Mexico sent its condolences to the Chilean people, and promised to offer aid.<ref name="china1"/>
* {{Flag|New Zealand}}: Prime Minister John Key said, "I am shocked by the devastation in Chile and would like to convey my sincere condolences to the people of Chile, President Michelle Bachelet and the Chilean Government. The New Zealand Government is prepared to provide assistance to Chile should this be requested."<ref>[http://www.voxy.co.nz/politics/pm-expresses-sympathy-chile-after-quake/5/39992 PM Expresses Sympathy To Chile After Quake]</ref>
* {{Flag|Pakistan}}: President [[Asif Ali Zardari]] released a message of condolence to the Chilean President concerning the earthquake saying that "We are deeply saddened by the loss of lives and damage to property caused by the severe earthquake that has hit your country",<ref name="Pakistan">{{Cite news|url=http://www.app.com.pk/en_/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=97466&Itemid=2|title=President saddened by Chile earthquake|agency=Associated Press of Pakistan|date=February 27, 2010|accessdate=February 27, 2010}}</ref> while Prime Minister [[Yousaf Raza Gillani]] ordered to begin the relief process and assured Chilean government of best support and cooperation of Pakistan.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.geo.tv/2-28-2010/60113.htm|title= President, PM grieved over deaths in Chile quake|date=February 28, 2010|publisher=Geo News|accessdate=28 February 2010}}</ref>
* {{Flag|Palestine}}: The president of the [[Palestinian National Authority]], [[Mahmoud Abbas]], expressed a message of condolence saying that "We have made it clear once again that President Bachelet of Chile and Palestinian peoples are found together in solidarity and fellowship. We know from our own history, the meaning of surviving tragedy and we are confident that Chile will overcome this sad time."<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://cl.globedia.com/abbas-solidariza-chile-pais-reside-mayor-comunidad-palestina-proximo|title=Abbas se solidariza con Chile|date=28/02/10}}</ref>
* {{flag|Peru}}: President [[Alan GarcÃ­a]] expressed his condolences for the loss of life and offered any service that the Chilean government and people would require from Peru.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.rpp.com.pe/2010-02-27-presidente-garcia-peru-esta-al-servicio-de-chile-tras-terremoto-noticia_245740.html|title=Peru is at service to Chile|date=February 27, 2010|publisher=RPP|accessdate=27 February 2010}}</ref> GarcÃ­a further declared that on March 1, 2010, Peru would have a [[National day of mourning]] to show support for the victims of the earthquake in Chile.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.peru.com/noticias/politica20100227/83471/Gobierno-peruano-declara-Duelo-Nacional-en-solidaridad-con-Chile-por-fuerte-terremoto|title=Gobierno peruano declara Duelo Nacional en solidaridad con Chile por fuerte terremoto|date=February 27, 2010|publisher=Peru.com|accessdate=25 February 2010}}</ref> On March 2, 2010, [[Alan GarcÃ­a]] and Foreign Affairs Minister [[JosÃ© GarcÃ­a BelaÃºnde]] visited Chile to meet with President [[Michelle Bachelet]] and Chile's President-elect [[SebastiÃ¡n PiÃ±era]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.brunei.fm/2010/03/03/peruvian-president-visits-chile-giving-support-and-aid/|title=Peruvian President visits Chile giving support and aid|date=03/03/10}}</ref> His visit also brought three planeloads of relief supplies, including a makeshift field hospital, tents and medicines.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://english.people.com.cn/90001/90777/90852/6907753.html|title=Peruvian president brings humanitarian aid to Chile|date=03/03/10}}</ref> He said that Peru will provide cash aid to earthquake-affected Peruvian citizens and will repatriate those who want to return to their home country.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.andina.com.pe/Ingles/Noticia.aspx?id=uhVAIiB9S0I=|title=Peruvian earthquake victims in Chile to receive cash aid from Government |date=03/02/10}}</ref>
* {{flag|Portugal}}: The [[President of Portugal]], [[Cavaco Silva]] sent a letter to his Chilean counterpart to express his sincere condolences on behalf of himself and the Portuguese people.<ref>[http://www.presidencia.pt/?idc=18&idi=37165 MENSAGENS â PÃ¡gina Oficial da PresidÃªncia da RepÃºblica Portuguesa] Retrieved on 2-27-10</ref>
* {{Flag|Qatar}}: The nation of Qatar sent a rescue team to Chile. On 7 March 2010 Members of the Internal Security Force (Lakhwiya) who left for quake-hit Chile on a humanitarian mission on Friday. The special force consists of doctors and other personnel who will help in the relief and rescue operations in the South American country. The team is also carrying with it 40 tonnes of aid materials including medicines, food packets and tents.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gulf-times.com/site/topics/printArticle.asp?cu_no=2&item_no=347042&version=1&template_id=36&parent_id=16 |title=Lakhwiya relief team for Chile |date=March 7, 2010}}</ref> Other details about the Qatari relief mission and sending of 40 tons of humanitarian aid material in the form of medicines, food packets, and tents were spoken of by a Qatari military official; "When the Qatar Emiri Air Force acquired two C-17s last year, we did so with every intention of supporting international disaster-relief and humanitarian missions around the world", said Brig. Gen. Ahmed Al-Malki, head of Qatar's airlift selection committee. "We take great pride in being among the first of many nations to respond to Haiti and Chile, delivering several thousand tons of food, water and medical supplies." <ref>http://www.pddnet.com/news-ap-boeing-qatar-emiri-air-force-laud-c-17-fleets-ach-031510/</ref>
* {{flag|Russia}} The Russian government sent a telegram of condolences.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://english.ruvr.ru/2010/02/27/4900906.html |title=Dmitry Medvedev expressed condolences to the President of Chile |date=February 27, 2010}}</ref>
* {{flag|Serbia}}: President [[Boris TadiÄ]] sent his condolences to Chilean president Michelle Bachelet "The people of Serbia sincerely share the pain of the Chilean people for the numerous victims and heavy material damage".<ref>[http://vesti.krstarica.com/?rubrika=scg&naslov=Tadic+addresses+condolences+to+Chilean+president&lang=1&sifra=7c02df2ac303911da4270b4e2329fc3a&dan=02&mesec=03&godina=2010 Tadic addresses condolences to Chilean president]</ref>
* {{flag|Singapore}}: Singapore donated $50,000 to quake hit Chile on March 3, 2010. Singapore announced on Wednesday a monetary donation of 50,000 U.S. dollars to Chile, which was rocked by a powerful earthquake early last Saturday.<ref>http://www.china.org.cn/world/chilequake/2010-03/03/content_19515597.htm</ref> The Singaporean president [[Sellapan Ramanathan]] provided a statement saying that "On behalf of the people of Singapore, he extended his deepest condolences to the quake victims and their families, and wished those injured a speedy recovery from their trauma."<ref name="xinhuanet1"/>
* {{flag|South Africa}}: The South African government expressed its condolences to the people of Chile. A statement was issued saying that "We indeed say our thoughts and prayers go out to the Chilean people during this difficult time."<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.eyewitnessnews.co.za/articleprog.aspx?id=33613|title=SA sends condolences to Chileans|date=28/02/10}}</ref>
* {{flag|South Korea}}: The South Korean government expressed its condolences in regards to the earthquake. A statement released by the government that was addressed to Chilean President Michelle Bachelet and President-elect [[Sebastian Pinera]] said that on behalf of South Korea, we express condolences to the bereaved families of those people who perished in the quake and to the Chilean people.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://joongangdaily.joins.com/article/view.asp?aid=2917171|title=S. Korea pledges aid to quake-hit Chile|date=28/02/10}}</ref>
* {{flag|Spain}}: The Spanish government in [[Madrid]] issued a statement saying that would provide all their available capabilities in the region to provide a coordinated response to this new disaster that has rocked a friendly and brother country.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jIlh9bsC2avEQBs36Iew_WVIAYWQ|title=World pledges aid to quake-hit Chile|date=28/02/10}}</ref>
* {{flag|Sri Lanka}}: The [[Politics of Sri Lanka|government of Sri Lanka]] expressed its sincere condolences to the president and public of Chile in the wake of the devastating earthquake.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Over 100 dead in Chile quake|url=http://www.dailymirror.lk/index.php/world/international/1909-over-100-dead-in-chile-quake.html|publisher=dailymirror.lk|accessdate=27 February 2010}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> Furthermore, the [[Colombo]] Department of Meteorology assessed that there would be no risk of tsunami conditions in the vicinity, as a result of the threat that distant shores could be inundated within hours.<ref>[http://www.dailymirror.lk/index.php/news/1902-no-tsunami-threat-to-sri-lanka.html No Tsunami threat to Sri Lanka] Retrieved on 27/02/10</ref>
*{{Flag|Sweden}}: Sweden's Prime Minister Fredrik Reinfeldt said that "We have via the Swedish Civil Contingencies Agency (MSB), said that we will contribute personnel...we are following the developments and are prepared to assist Chile...It is important to follow how serious the consequences are. We have already heard that there is much devastation and many have died in Chile." Reinfeldt mentioned that there are strong bands between Sweden and Chile, as there are many people of Chilean origin living in Sweden.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.svd.se/nyheter/inrikes/sverige-erbjuder-chile-hjalp_4346247.svd|title=Sverige erbjuder Chile hjÃ¤lp|date=28 february 2010|publisher=Svenska Dagbladet|accessdate=2 March 2010}}</ref> The Swedish government is also working with the Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (SIDA). MSB has assessed the needs that Chile requires from the international community and will contribute the equipment and aid workers that Sweden has available, says the Swedish newspaper ''Svenska Dagbladet''. "It is a match with the requests (from Chile) and with the contributions of other EU nations", said MSB's press-secretary Karin Wiklund. Save the Children Sweden has personal in Chile assessing the situation and how they can contribute, and will make contributions as soon as the areas of need are understood. "We are very thankful for the solidarity that Sweden shows", Chile's ambassador to Sweden, JosÃ© Miguel Cruz is quoted as saying in ''Svenska Dagbladet''. There are many thousands of Swedes with relatives in Chile, and the Swedish government is working to connect people to their relatives.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.svd.se/nyheter/utrikes/chile-ber-om-hjalp-efter-katastrofen_4354385.svd|title=Chile ber om hjÃ¤lp efter katastrofen|date=1 March 2010|publisher=Svenska Dagbladet|accessdate=2 March 2010}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.msb.se/sv/Start1/Nyheter-fran-MSB/Nyheter/Svensk-hjalp-till-jordbavningsdrabbade-Chile/|title=Svensk hjÃ¤lp till jordbÃ¤vningsdrabbade Chile|date=2 march 2010|publisher=Swedish Civil Contingencies Agency (MSB)|accessdate=2 March 2010}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.sr.se/sida/gruppsida.aspx?programid=3304&grupp=6403&artikel=3475081|title=Ãver 300 000 evakuerade kan Ã¥tervÃ¤nda|date=28 February|publisher=Sveriges Radio|accessdate=2 March 2010}}</ref>
* {{Flag|Switzerland}}: The Swiss [[Federal Department of Foreign Affairs]] said on Saturday that it would send experts already based in South America to the scene. They were expected to arrive on Sunday and would determine once on the ground how best to help. Chile had not requested assistance.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Government sends team to Chile after quake|url=http://www.swissinfo.ch/eng/index/Swiss_send_aid_workers_to_Chile_after_quake.html?cid=8383604|publisher=swissinfo.ch|accessdate=27 February 2010}}</ref> The Swiss embassy, located in one of the most heavily affected areas of Santiago, suffered heavy damage.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Swiss embassy heavily damaged in Chile|url=http://www.swissinfo.ch/eng/swiss_news/Swiss_embassy_heavily_damaged_in_Chile.html?cid=8384742|publisher=swissinfo.ch|accessdate=28 February 2010}}</ref>
* {{Flag|Thailand}}: [[Abhisit Vejjajiva]], the Prime Minister of Thailand expressed heartfelt condolences to Chileans, especially the families affected by the earthquake.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mcot.net/content/26559|title=Thailand expresses condolences to quake-hit Chile |date=28/02/10}}</ref>
* {{Flag|Tunisia}}: The Tunisian president [[Zine El Abidine Ben Ali]] sent his condolences on the behalf of Tunisia to President Bachelet.<ref name="china1"/>
* {{Flag|Turkey}}: The Turkish Ministry of Foreign Affairs expressed profound sorrow over the loss of lives in the Chilean earthquake disaster.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.worldbulletin.net/news_detail.php?id=54773|title=Turkey expresses sorrow over Chilean quake victims|date=28/02/10}}</ref>
* {{Flag|Ukraine}}: The Ukrainian Government, in a letter given to the Chilean consulate in [[Kiev]], expressed condolences with regard to the damage and the tragic loss of life caused by the earthquake.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://poslezavtra.com.ua/na-ameriku-nadvigaetsya-cunami/ |title=ÐÐ° ÐÐ¼ÐµÑÐ¸ÐºÑ Ð½Ð°Ð´Ð²Ð¸Ð³Ð°ÐµÑÑÑ ÑÑÐ½Ð°Ð¼Ð¸ |date=28/02/10}}</ref>
* {{Flag|United Kingdom}}: The British Red Cross donated Â£50,000 to help the victims of Chile earthquake.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.redcross.org.uk/news.asp?id=103128|title=Quick response made to Chile earthquake|date=27 February 2010|publisher=British Red Cross|accessdate=27 February 2010}}</ref> Prime Minister [[Gordon Brown]] said in a press statement that Britain would do whatever it could to help after the earthquake in the centre of Chile. UK-based aid organisations including [[Oxfam]], [[Christian Aid]] and [[Save the Children]] started collecting donations as emergency teams prepared to fly in to the quake-affected area.<ref>{{Cite news|title=UK relief charity teams fly to Chile earthquake zone|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/8540621.stm|date=27 February 2010|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=27 February 2010}}</ref> Oxfam is today sending a team of water engineers and logisticians from Colombia and senior humanitarian staff from its centre in Mexico.<ref>{{Cite news|title=Oxfam send staff to respond to Chilean Earthquake|url=http://www.oxfam.org/en/pressroom/pressrelease/2010-02-27/oxfam-send-staff-respond-chilean-earthquake}}</ref>
[[File:Barack Obama gives statement on 2010 Chile earthquake 2010-02-27.ogg|thumb|right|[[President of the United States|US President]] [[Barack Obama]] made a statement on the earthquake in Chile.]]
* {{flag|United States}}: The State Department established a web-based Chile Earthquake Google Person Finder and set up an emergency phone line for seeking information about missing people in the quake-affected area. White House Press Secretary [[Robert Gibbs]] said in a press statement that "We are closely monitoring the situation, including the potential for a tsunami, and Our thoughts and prayers are with the people of Chile, and we stand ready to help in this hour of need."<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://voices.washingtonpost.com/federal-eye/2010/02/chile_quake_the_us_government.html|title=Chile quake: The U.S. government response|date=February 27, 2010|publisher=The Washington Post|accessdate=27 February 2010}}</ref> President Obama cautions Americans in Hawaii and Guam to pay attention to local officials. The [[United States Air Force|U.S. Air Force]] delivers several [[C-130]] cargo planes to help with aid and evacuations.<ref>[http://www.cbn.com/cbnnews/world/2010/March/Quake-Hits-Turkey-as-Haiti-Chile-Cont-Recovery/ Quake Hits Turkey as Haiti, Chile Cont. Recovery] March 8, 2010. Accessed March 10, 2010.</ref>
* {{flag|Vatican City}}: "I pray for the victims and am spiritually close to the people tested by such a grave calamity; for these I implore from God relief from the suffering and courage in this adversity", said Pope Benedict XVI in St. Peter's Square.
* {{Flag|Venezuela}}: The Venezuelan government, through its foreign ministry, sent a message of solidarity to the victims of the earthquake and offered his collaboration.<ref>{{Cite web|title=TeleSURtv.net â Crece solidaridad internacional con Chile tras el terremoto|url=http://www.telesurtv.net/noticias/secciones/nota/67519-NN/crece-solidaridad-internacional-con-chile-tras-el-terremoto/}}</ref>
==Intergovernmental organizations==
* {{flag|European Union}}: [[Kristalina Georgieva]] from [[Humanitarian Aid and Crisis Response of European Commissioner for International Cooperation]] released condolences message to the families of victims immediately and assured of best co-operation.<ref>{{Cite web|title=EU's response to Chile earthquake: aid commissioner Georgieva's statement|date=February 27, 2010|url=http://www.sofiaecho.com/2010/02/27/865765_eus-response-to-chile-earthquake-aid-commissioner-georgievas-statement|publisher=The Sofia Echo|accessdate=27 February 2010}}</ref> Georgieva said she had immediately activated the commission's crisis monitoring unit and told its humanitarian aid experts "to undertake urgent needs assessments if required".<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.eubusiness.com/news-eu/chile-quake.367|title=EU ready to help Chile quake victims: Aid CommissionerâEU Business News|publisher=EUbusiness.com|date=|accessdate=2010-02-28}}</ref> The European Union pledged â¬3 million in immediate assistance as aid workers rushed to Chile.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.eubusiness.com/news-eu/chile-quake-world.36g|title=World pledges aid to quake-hit ChileâEU Business News|publisher=EUbusiness.com|date=|accessdate=2010-02-28}}</ref>
* {{flag|Organization of American States}}: [[Secretary General]] [[JosÃ© Miguel Insulza]], himself a native of Chile, promised "all the cooperation that the OAS can provide".<ref>[http://www.oas.org/OASpage/press_releases/press_release.asp?sCodigo=E-059/10 Statement of the OAS Secretary General, 2010-02-27]</ref>
* {{flag|United Nations}}: Secretary-General [[Ban Ki-moon]] expressed his condolences for the loss of life in the quake.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www1.voanews.com/english/news/americas/International-Community-Pledges-Support-for-Chile-Following-Quake-85687877.html|title=International Community Pledges Support for Chile Following Quake|date=27 February 2010|publisher=Voice of America|accessdate=27 February 2010}}</ref>
* [[World Bank]]: The president of the [[World Bank]] Group, [[Robert B. Zoellick]] issued a statement saying that the institution was ready to help the victims of Chile's massive earthquake as he expressed his condolences following the disaster that hit the center and south of the country.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.reliefweb.int/rw/rwb.nsf/db900SID/MUMA-8347LB?OpenDocument |title=World Bank Ready to Help Chile in Aftermath of Earthquake |date=27/02/10}}</ref>
==Charitable organizations==
* [[File:Emblem of the IFRC.svg|22x20px]] The [[International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies]] has released 300,000 Swiss francs (c. Â£140,420) from its Disaster Emergency Response Fund.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.alertnet.org/thenews/fromthefield/216872/777e986d219ba04ec5350be75c9c4850.htm|title=Red Cross launches Chile Earthquake Appeal |date=28 February 2010|publisher=Reuters AlertNet|accessdate=1 March 2010}}</ref>
* [[Humanity First]] from Canada and USA is prepared a disaster relief team.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.humanityfirst.ca/ |title=Humanity First |publisher=Humanityfirst.ca |date= |accessdate=2010-03-08}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://usa.humanityfirst.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=155 |title=Major Earthquake in Chile |publisher=Usa.humanityfirst.org |date=2010-02-27 |accessdate=2010-03-08}}</ref>
*UK-based [[Oxfam]] immediately sent a team of water engineers and logistics experts, and also announced an emergency appeal for donations for the victims of the earthquake.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.oxfam.org/en/pressroom/pressrelease/2010-02-27/oxfam-send-staff-respond-chilean-earthquake|title=Oxfam send staff to respond to Chilean Earthquake |date=27 February 2010|publisher=Oxfam|accessdate=28 February 2010}}</ref>
*UK-based [[Save the Children]] made an appeal for donations.<ref>[https://www.savethechildren.org.uk/secure/51_10715.htm Save the Children appeal], savethechildren.org.uk. Retrieved 28 February 2010.</ref>
*UK-based [[Christian Aid]] made an appeal for donations.<ref>[http://www.christianaid.org.uk/emergencies/current/chile-earthquake/index.aspx?gclid=CNGYp5KglaACFZJr4wodHWCbeQ Christian Aid appeal], christianaid.org.uk. Retrieved 28 February 2010.</ref>
* {{Flag icon|ICRC|cross}} US-based [[American Red Cross]] pledged $450,000 from its International Response Fund.<ref>[http://www.usatoday.com/news/world/2010-02-27-chile-earthquake_N.htm At least 708 killed in Chile earthquake] [[USA Today]]. Retrieved February 28, 2010.</ref>
==Commercial organizations==
*US-based [[Wal-Mart|Wal-Mart Stores, Inc.]] announced an initial commitment of $1 million to go toward emergency relief efforts throughout Chile.<ref>[http://walmartstores.com/FactsNews/NewsRoom/9675.aspx Walmart Commits $1 million in Response to Chile Earthquake] [[Wal-Mart]] press release, February 27, 2010. Retrieved February 28, 2010.</ref>
*[[Scotiabank]] announced $250,000 in aid for Chile, and a relief fund would be set up through its bank branches in Canada.<ref>CNW Group, [http://www.newswire.ca/en/releases/archive/March2010/01/c5818.html "Scotiabank Contributes Cdn $250,000 to Chile Earthquake Relief Effort"], '''Joe Konecny''', ''1 March 2010'' . Retrieved 2 March 2010.</ref>
*Mining concern [[Anglo American plc]] announced $10 million in aid for emergency water and power, and reconstruction of homes and schools.<ref>Steel Guru, [http://steelguru.com/news/index/MTM1NTkw/Anglo_American_donates_USD_10_million_to_support_reconstruction_in_Chile.html "Anglo American donates USD 10 million to support reconstruction in Chile"], ''6 March 2010'' . Retrieved 6 March 2010.</ref>
*[[Hyundai]]/[[Kia Motors|Kia]] announced $200,000 in aid for Chile.<ref>Trading Market, [http://www.tradingmarkets.com/news/stock-alert/kimty_hyundai-kia-to-provide-us-200-000-in-aid-to-quake-stricken-chile-831811.html "Hyundai, Kia to provide US$200,000 in aid to quake-stricken Chile"], '''COMTEX''', ''5 March 2010'' (accessed 9 March 2010)</ref>
==Social media==
* [[Twitter]] users following #Chile and #tsunami directed each other to various media and government sites (as well as the usual rumors and folklore).<ref>[http://edition.cnn.com/2010/WORLD/americas/02/27/chile.quake.tsunami.web/ Web sites, social networks blast out earthquake, tsunami information], By Jim Kavanagh, CNN, February 27, 2010 â Updated 1705 GMT (0105 HKT).</ref>
==Timeline of relief efforts after the 2010 Chile earthquake== {{Main|Timeline of relief efforts after the 2010 Chile earthquake}} The '''timeline of relief efforts after the [[2010 Chile earthquake]]''' of 27 February 2010 involves the sequence of events in the days following a highly destructive 8.8 [[Moment magnitude scale|Mw]] earthquake with an [[epicenter]] deep underground, offshore, near [[Maule, Chile]].<ref>USGS, [http://earthquake.usgs.gov/earthquakes/recenteqsww/Quakes/us2010tfan.php#details Magnitude 8.8 - OFFSHORE MAULE, CHILE - 27 February 2010 06:34:14 UTC] . Retrieved 1 March 2010.</ref>
==Specialist incidents== Over 50 countries including Brazil, the [[People's Republic of China]] and [[Argentina]] gave aid to [[Chile]] after March the 1st, 2010.{{Citation needed|date=March 2010}}
===Earthquake casualties and specialist aid given=== [[File:Chile provinces earthquake dead.png|thumb|right|175px|The regional death toll in the [[2010 Chile earthquake]] from initial reports on February the 27th, 03.23 to 16.00 on March the 1st.]]
The death toll was initially put at 124 on February 27{{Citation needed|date=March 2010}}, then a total of 708 was declared on 16.00 on March the 1st{{Citation needed|date=March 2010}} and included missing people, the number was updated by the government of Chile and decreased to 279 by 09.00 on March 4,<ref name="Ministry of Interior">{{Cite news|url=http://www.interior.gov.cl/n1266_05-03-2010.html|title=Lista Oficial de Fallecidos|date=03 Marzo 2010|work=[[Ministry of Interior (Chile)|Ministry of Interior]]|accessdate=13 March 2010}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news| url=http://www.nytimes.com/reuters/2010/03/04/world/international-us-quake-chile.html | work=The New York Times}} {{Dead link|date=August 2010|bot=RjwilmsiBot}}</ref> because only confirmed decesead victims of the event were counted. As new victims were identified and confirmed by the government the number raised, first come to 452 by March 5,<ref name="Ministry of Interior">{{Cite news|url=http://www.interior.gov.cl/n1271_05-03-2010.html|title=Lista Oficial de Fallecidos|date=05 Marzo 2010|work=[[Ministry of Interior (Chile)|Ministry of Interior]]|accessdate=13 March 2010}}</ref> and to 497 by March 8,<ref name="Ministry of Interior">{{Cite news|url=http://www.interior.gov.cl/filesapp/lista_oficial_fallecidos.pdf/|title=Lista Oficial de Fallecidos|date=11 Marzo 2010|work=[[Ministry of Interior (Chile)|Ministry of Interior]]|accessdate=11 March 2010}}</ref> being that the last official report of the Ministry of Interior of Chile.
===Tsunami casualties and specialist aid given=== It reached Easter island in a few hours and finally reached Japan and New Zealand after about 1 day.{{Citation needed|date=March 2010}} Argentina has sent construction teams to Chiloe island to help reconstruct some of the washed away coastal buildings.{{Citation needed|date=March 2010}}
===Looting and the police response=== 160 people were arrested by military police in Concepcion between March 1 and 2.<ref>BBC News, [http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/americas/8542789.stm "Chile troops tackle earthquake looters"], ''20:39 GMT, Monday, 1 March 2010''</ref>
===Church ceremonies=== There will be a special mass in [[ValparaÃ­so]] on March 3 to remember the town's dead.{{Citation needed|date=March 2010}}
===Chilean political responses=== {{Empty section|date=March 2010}}
